bug.author: pengzhangzhi
bug.description:
Dear sir: I came across an error when I installed poutyne with "pip install -U git+<denchmark-link:https://github.com/GRAAL-Research/poutyne.git@dev>https://github.com/GRAAL-Research/poutyne.git@dev</denchmark-link> ". I think the problem is in my torch.As the Error information said: "ERROR: Failed building wheel for torch". But I have no idea in solving this.So I hope you can provide some solution to me. The overall error feedback is in below. Thanks! <denchmark-h:h2>ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: command: 'c:\users\彭张智computational ai\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\python.exe' -u -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'C:\Users\彭张智computational AI\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-install-fgpcp5ez	orch\setup.py'"'"'; file='"'"'C:\Users\彭张智computational AI\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-install-fgpcp5ez	orch\setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(file);code=f.read().replace('"'"'
'"'"', '"'"'
'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, file, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' bdist_wheel -d 'C:\Users\彭张智computational AI\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-wheel-f_6axmet' cwd: C:\Users\彭张智computational comments.comment:
Hi, on Windows, you need to install torch first using the instructions on the PyTorch's website: <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/>https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/</denchmark-link>
As noted, on Windows, you can use this command to install torch: pip install torch===1.6.0 torchvision===0.7.0 -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html Afterwards, you can install Poutyne as you tried. Let me know it works.

Hi, on Windows, you need to install torch first using the instructions on the PyTorch's website: https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/ As noted, on Windows, you can use this command to install torch: pip install torch===1.6.0 torchvision===0.7.0 -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html Afterwards, you can install Poutyne as you tried. Let me know it works.
Sir,thank you for such a considerable response.But I have installed torch before in my win10. For your information, the version of my torch is :1.2.0.
Hi, can you try installing the latest version i.e. 1.6.0 ?

Hey! Thanks for your quick response.Would you mind to give me the code that upgrade my torch? I just tried to upgrade my torch with code "conda config --add channels soumith conda update pytorch torchvision" After successfully installed, the version is still '1.2.0'. I was barely good at this stuff! Sorry to bother you!
If you use conda, according to the <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/>website</denchmark-link> :

Still didn't work. I used the code you given to me. conda install pytorch torchvision cudatoolkit=10.2 -c pytorch the result is as followed : <denchmark-code>Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): done Solving environment: failed with initial frozen solve. Retrying with flexible solve. Solving environment: failed with repodata from current_repodata.json, will retry with next repodata source. Collecting package metadata (repodata.json): done Solving environment: failed with initial frozen solve. Retrying with flexible solve. </denchmark-code>

Can you try to uninstall your current PyTorch installation first? If this does not work, can you try to remove the channel soumith that you added? If these do not work, I would recommend you to completely remove Anaconda from your system and do a clean installation.
Hi, Did you succeed? If so, can you close the issue? Thank you.
I'm going to close the issue. If you need more help, don't hesitate to reopen it.
OK! It's very kind of you for such caring help! Thanks a million : )
